Package game.body.walkers.mobs

Class MobWalker

java.lang.Object
city.cs.engine.Body
city.cs.engine.DynamicBody
city.cs.engine.Walker
game.body.walkers.WalkerFrame
game.body.walkers.mobs.MobWalker
Direct Known Subclasses:
HuntressWalker, WizardWalker, WormWalker
public abstract class MobWalker extends WalkerFrame
The core abstract class for all mobs in the game. Allows for easy creation of new mob types. Core logic is handled here and passed to the necessary parts, thus allowing for an API for MobWalkers.
Since:
13-02-2025
Author:
Alexander Smolowitz, alexander.smolowitz@city.ac.uk

      Parameters:
      gameWorld - The game world that the mob is in.
      boxShape - The shape of the mob.
      origin - The origin of the mob.
      mobType - The type of mob.

  • Method Details

    • updateName

      public void updateName(String identifier)
      Updates the name of the mob by adding the identifier to the end of the name.
      Parameters:
      identifier - The identifier to add to the name.

    • attack

      public void attack()
      Starts a 700 ms timer or a 2000 ms timer for a WormWalker, when the timer ends, the mob attacks.

    • damagePlayer

      public void damagePlayer()
      Damages the player for 125 damage.

    • die

      public void die()
      Removes stepListeners, calls DropTable.dropItem(GameWorld, Vec2) to drop an item. Checks if all mobs are dead, and then destroys itself.
      Overrides:
      die in class WalkerFrame
      See Also:
      • SoundFX

    • takeDamage

      public void takeDamage(int damage)
      Method for a mob to take damage and check if it is dead, allowing for the death system to begin.
      Parameters:
      damage - may be changed to a WalkerType or something similar, used to access a static damage variable of a class.

    • getSupportedStates

      public abstract State[] getSupportedStates()
      Method to get the supported States.enum for the mob. Generally used for the Mob's animation frames.
      Returns:
      array of states that the mob supports.

    • setBehaviour

      public void setBehaviour(WalkerBehaviour behaviour)
      Sets the WalkerBehaviour of the mob. Changes the mobStepListener accordingly.
      Parameters:
      behaviour - The behaviour of the mob.
